title: 0 of X required images are available in the registry
content: You successfully download and upload images to the registry. When you try to deploy a suite on Amazon EKS, you receive an error message that resembles the following on the "Check Image Availability" page of the installation portal: 0 of 96 required images are available in the registry This issue is most likely to occur when the installation process takes 12 hours or longer. Cause This issue occurs because Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) uses short-lived credentials, whereas the OMT credentials (registrypullsecret) are long-lived. Therefore, the OMT credentials may expire when the installation process takes a long time. Solution A script (refresh-ecr-secret.sh) is available to refresh the OMT credentials. To use the script, follow these steps: On the Amazon EKS bastion node, run the following command: ./<ITOM_Platform_Foundation_BYOK_20XX.XX.00XXX.zip>/scripts/refresh-ecr-secret.sh -r <region> In this command, <ITOM_Platform_Foundation_BYOK_20XX.XX.00XXX.zip> represents your ins
titleLower: 0 of x required images are available in the registry
contentLower: you successfully download and upload images to the registry. when you try to deploy a suite on amazon eks, you receive an error message that resembles the following on the "check image availability" page of the installation portal: 0 of 96 required images are available in the registry this issue is most likely to occur when the installation process takes 12 hours or longer. cause this issue occurs because amazon elastic container registry (ecr) uses short-lived credentials, whereas the omt credentials (registrypullsecret) are long-lived. therefore, the omt credentials may expire when the installation process takes a long time. solution a script (refresh-ecr-secret.sh) is available to refresh the omt credentials. to use the script, follow these steps: on the amazon eks bastion node, run the following command: ./<itom_platform_foundation_byok_20xx.xx.00xxx.zip>/scripts/refresh-ecr-secret.sh -r <region> in this command, <itom_platform_foundation_byok_20xx.xx.00xxx.zip> represents your ins

title: 403 error messages in OPB Controller Log
content: The OPB controller log contains the following error： ERROR [Fetch XIE Tasks Executor Service-1-thread] (HttpClientRequestInvoker.java:107) HTTP failure! URI: https://shc-sma-cd41.hpeswlab.net:443/xie/v1/namespaces/555500000/agents/28c7fb1b821b766518bda268/task/100/list; Status: HTTP/1.1 403 Cause In addition to the OPB Remote Agent role, the integration user needs the Tenant Admin role when using Rest Executor 2.0 to invoke the integration engine. This issue occurs if the integration user isn't assigned this role. Solution Ignore this error if your integration doesn't use Rest Executor 2.0. If your OPB integration uses Rest Executor 2.0, assign the Tenant Admin role to the integration user. See How to use On-Premises Bridge agents on Linux or How to use On-Premises Bridge agents on Windows for help.
titleLower: 403 error messages in opb controller log
contentLower: the opb controller log contains the following error： error [fetch xie tasks executor service-1-thread] (httpclientrequestinvoker.java:107) http failure! uri: https://shc-sma-cd41.hpeswlab.net:443/xie/v1/namespaces/555500000/agents/28c7fb1b821b766518bda268/task/100/list; status: http/1.1 403 cause in addition to the opb remote agent role, the integration user needs the tenant admin role when using rest executor 2.0 to invoke the integration engine. this issue occurs if the integration user isn't assigned this role. solution ignore this error if your integration doesn't use rest executor 2.0. if your opb integration uses rest executor 2.0, assign the tenant admin role to the integration user. see how to use on-premises bridge agents on linux or how to use on-premises bridge agents on windows for help.

title: 409 Conflict error when deploying OO capability
content: When you try to deploy or redeploy the Operations Orchestration (OO) capability on a tenant, the system returns a 409 Conflict error after you click Deploy or Redeploy. Cause During the OO capability deployment, the system creates an OO tenant. You can manage the OO tenant in the OO Central pod by calling the OO Controller API. The OO Controller returns a 409 Conflict error when: The system is trying to delete or activate an OO tenant in ACTIVATED status. The system is trying to deactivate an OO tenant in DEACTIVATED status. The system is trying to create an OO tenant that already exists in OO Central. You trigger another OO job when one existing OO job is still in progress (even if the two jobs are running on two different tenants). The specific cause of a 409 Conflict error could be one of the following. Cause 1 You have triggered the OO capability deployment for two tenants at the same time. That is, you trigger the OO capability deployment for another tenant while the OO capability
